edu.balboa.apcs.MineSweeper

Class MineField

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.balboa.apcs.MineSweeper.MineField

  • public class MineField
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a MineField which keeps track of the current game board, keeps track of the number of rows/columns the current board has, and lastly holds a method with the percents of Squares being mined.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MineField(int numRows)
      Creates a MineField and randomly places mines in Squares.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Square[][] getBoard()
      Returns the 2D array holding the Squares (our current "game board").
      int getNumMinedSquares()
      Returns numberofRows multiplied by itself and multiplied by 16% in Board
      int getNumRows()
      Returns the number of rows in game Board.
      int getNumSquares()
      Returns the total number of Squares in game Board.
      Square getSquareAt(int y, int x)
      Returns the Square in the 2D array board at row y and column x
      void inspect(int y, int x)
      This inspect method "reveals" the Square it is called on to show the number of mines in the squares adjacent to it, and if there aren't any, calls inspect on all of the adjacent squares

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • getNumMinedSquares

        public int getNumMinedSquares()

        total number of mined squares

        public Square getSquareAt(int y,
                          int x)

        Returns:

      • inspect

        public void inspect(int y,
                    int x)
        This inspect method "reveals" the Square it is called on to show the number of mines in the squares adjacent to it, and if there aren't any, calls inspect on all of the adjacent squares
        Parameters:
        y - the Square's row
        x - the Square's column
